abstract: The private equity firm Leonard Green & Partners offered $61 a share for Jo-Ann Stores on Thursday — a 34 percent premium to the company’s closing price on Wednesday.
snippet: The private equity firm Leonard Green & Partners offered $61 a share for Jo-Ann Stores on Thursday — a 34 percent premium to the company’s closing price on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: Jo-Ann Stores agreed to a $1.6 billion buyout offer on Thursday from Leonard Green & Partners, the latest private equity deal for a retail company.

headline.main: Leonard Green Offers $1.6 Billion for Jo-Ann Stores

byline.original: By Adrienne Carter and Jeffrey Cane

abstract: DealBook’s Andrew Ross Sorkin talks to CNBC about why the bank is registering domain names.
snippet: DealBook’s Andrew Ross Sorkin talks to CNBC about why the bank is registering domain names.
lead_paragraph: DealBook’s Andrew Ross Sorkin talks to CNBC about why Bank of America is protectively registering domain names related to its executives and board members, and parses the fallout from the dispute between Starwood Hotels & Resorts and Hilton Worldwide.

headline.main: How Bank of America Hopes to Counter WikiLeaks Threat
